.
Centralized Processing for Rating and Authorization of Herbicide Claims
Centralized processing of the rating and authorization activities is required for certain herbicide claims.  These include cases with
explicit or implicit claims of RVN-based nautical service, and
no in-country service at a presumptive herbicide location, or
a previously denied claim based on no qualifying service, or
service in the RVN,
and
potential
Nehmer
applicability under
38 CFR 3.816
.
References
:  For more information on
explicit or implicit claims of RVN-based nautical service, see the
PACT Act Implementation SOP
content titled,
Evidence of Nautical Service
, and
claims requiring centralized processing for research of herbicide exposure, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart i, 1.A.1.c
.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart i, Chapter 1, Section B - Ratings for Disabilities Associated with Herbicide Exposure
citation: Part VIII, Subpart i, Chapter 1, Section B
